column1: The types of crimes and arrests shown in this report are:
column2: The types of crimes and arrests shown in this report are:
Violent offenses and arrests: murder/non-negligent manslaughter, forcible rape and other
column3: Violent offenses and arrests: murder/non-negligent manslaughter, forcible rape and other

column2: forcible sex offenses, robbery, and aggravated assault.
Property offenses and arrests: burglary, larceny, motor vehicle theft, fraud, destruction-damage-
column3: Property offenses and arrests: burglary, larceny, motor vehicle theft, fraud, destruction-damage-

column2: vandalism, and “all other property offenses.”
Drug arrests are for both drug/narcotics violations and drug equipment violations.
column3: Drug arrests are for both drug/narcotics violations and drug equipment violations.

column2: Basic findings

column1: From January 2011 through December 2011 compared to the same time period in 2010:
column2: From January 2011 through December 2011 compared to the same time period in 2010:
column3: From January 2011 through December 2011 compared to the same time period in 2010:

column2: The number of violent crimes dropped by 5.8%.
column3: The number of violent crime arrests dropped

column2: The number of property crimes dropped by 4.8%.
column3: Property crime arrests increased by 0.1%.

column2: The increase in property crime arrests was driven by increases in arrests for larceny (+2.9%)
column3: The increase in property crime arrests was driven by increases in arrests for larceny (+2.9%)

column2: and burglary (+1.4%).
Drug arrests increased by 2.1%.
